titleStmt.title: On ye Death of ye Duke of Orleans by
\del·Mr Pope.\ Dr Swift.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: ye Duke of Orleans. Fable frô Æsop. Hedges & Broxholm. Alsopus Keilo, &c
How vain are Mortal Mans endevours
Said att St. James's Master Travers.
Good Orleans Dead?──in truth 'tis hard──
Oh! may all Statesmen die prepar'd!
I do forsee──(& in forseeing
He equals any Man in being)──
The Army ne'er can be disbanded──
──I wish yeKing was safely Landed.
Ah! Friends! great Changes threat this land,
All France & England's att a stand,
There's Mireweys yt makes strange Work
And there's yeCzar, & there's yeTurk,
The Pope──An Indian Merchant by
Cut short his Speech made this reply.Things at a Stand? why dread such Changes
Ah! Sr You never saw ye Ganges,
There dwelt a Race; we call 'em Monkeys
Grave, Sober, Sage, like our Quid-Nunc-ys
On either Bank, from bowugh to bough
They meet & Chatt; as we do now,
Whispers go round, they grin, they shrug
They bow, they snarl, they scrath, they hugg,
And just as chance, or whim provoke 'em,
They either bite, their friends or stroake 'em.
There have I seen some Active Prig,
To shew his parts, bestride a Twig,
Lord! how ye Chatt'ring Tribe admire!
Not that he's wiser, but is higher──
All long to try ye Ventrous thing,
(For Power's but to have Ones Swing)
From Side to Side, he Springs, he Spurns
And bangs his Foes, & Friends by turns.
Tthus as in giddy Freaks & bounces
Crack goes ye Twig, & in he Flounces,
Down ye Swift stream the Wretch is born,
Never! ah! never to return!Z──ds wt: a fall has our Dear BrotherMorbleu, crys one, & D──mee t'other.
The Nation gives a General screech,
None clawscocks his Tail, none claws his Br──ch.
Each trembles for ye Publick Weal,
And for a While forgetts to steal;
A While all Eyes intent, & steady
Pursue him whirling down ye Eddy.
But out o' Mind when out o' View
Some other mounts, ye Twig a New,
And Business on each Monkey Shore
Runs ye same track, it went before.Y20-801Y
